about.summary: A suite of custom R Markdown formats and templates for authoring journal articles and conference submissions.

name: r-rticles
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.14" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-rticles
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/rticles_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/rticles/rticles_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 672abfc7c4a24a281c1dd46ff947db65280e1add52291227845f69455674e78c

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-knitr
    - r-rmarkdown
    - r-tinytex
    - r-xfun
    - r-yaml
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-knitr
    - r-rmarkdown
    - r-tinytex
    - r-xfun
    - r-yaml

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('rticles')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('rticles')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/rstudio/rticles
  license: GPL-3
  summary: A suite of custom R Markdown formats and templates for authoring journal articles
    and conference submissions.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
